attributes.action: HMG should consider economic implications, not always jumping on greenhouse bandwagon. Earth’s temperature fluctuates within its 4.5 bn year existence
attributes.additional_details: Using ‘green energy’ options can costly & inhibit economic growth. UK should not ‘shoot herself in the foot’ by being unilaterally green.  China, Russia, India, etc will not. Climate change is multi-factorial & their interactions can be difficult to predict. Hardly anyone talk about the greenhouse effects before it became widely publicised about 12 years ago. Climate change due to CO2 greenhouse effects palls into insignificance when sun flares occur, large meteorite strike the earth, when earth’s magnetic poles reverse its polarity. The earth’s circular orbit with the sun can revert to elliptical orbit causing the next ice age, which has been predicted to may occur again in around 2030. If enough cold, fresh water coming from the melting polar ice caps and the melting glaciers of Greenland flows into the northern Atlantic, it will shut down the warm Gulf Stream & then instead of increased global warming, winter would set in for all of Europe, Siberia and eastern USA.
